definition: to force the king or emperor to abdicate
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
variant of 逼[bi1]/to compel/to pressure
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
surname Gong

sentences.english: Three years later, he induced the boy emperor to abdicate in his favour.
sentences.chinese: 三年后，他诱导孩子逼宫在他的赞成票。

definition: to seize power
to seize the throne
to change sides in a war/turncoat
internal strife
conspiracy/secret plan/to conspire
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to threaten/to blackmail
to seize
lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom)/to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful
to submit/to give in
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]

definition: turncoat/traitor
